alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia; Western Columbia River Gorge (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 02 at 2:58AM PST until March 02 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 700 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches above 700 feet. Highest amounts above 1000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Oregon, Lower Columbia and Western Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County, Greater Vancouver Area and Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Through 1 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Spotty, slushy accumulations of a dusting to half an inch are possible below 700 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Lower Columbia; Western Columbia River Gorge
